steps.comment: Get the latest content for the cdm instance
Get all active relations
Get the instance
If it's new, there might not be content yet, create an empty object
steps.label: !currentContent

steps.comment: Get the primary key field

steps.description: ="Could not find primary key field for: " + instance/typeId
steps.label: !primaryKeyField
steps.message: Could not find primary key field

steps.comment: Instantiate actual instance
Set the primary key value
Get all subscriptions for this type and the given systems
If we haven't resolved it yet, get the primary key field
steps.label: !primaryKeyField

steps.comment: Get all the subscription instances for this particular cdm instance. We also need a stable date for later comparison to prevent additional unnecessary pulls.
steps.label: subscriptions

steps.comment: If we have no pull interval, set to 5 minutes. By default we don't want to overpoll systems and want to be able to push content. You can manually set it lower if necessary
steps.label: subscription/pullInterval == null

steps.comment: Get the current instance subscription and the correct relations
Deleted in the target system
steps.label: instanceSubscription/decoupled != null
input/force != true && subscription/pullInterval != null && instanceSubscription/pulled != null

steps.comment: Set pull to false if we are not yet at the window
If we pulled in the past and its not decoupled, we _should_ have content? If we don't, skip
steps.label: !pull && instanceSubscription/content == null

steps.comment: Check that we don't need to skip it
steps.label: input/skipPullForSystem != null && pull

steps.comment: Get the remote data
steps.label: true

steps.comment: Otherwise, we take the previous version
Update the ids
steps.label: newExternalIds

steps.comment: If we have no partial instance, we can't do much
steps.label: partialInstance == null

steps.comment: If we had content before but now don't have any, we decouple it
steps.label: instanceSubscription/content != null

steps.comment: Continue with the next
Only update our system if we actually pulled data
steps.label: pull

steps.comment: Update relations
Marshal the data
If it did not exist yet, create it
steps.label: !instanceSubscription

steps.comment: Otherwise, we update it
If we have a master type, let's limit our impact to that. Let's also figure out if the system changed fields beyond that
steps.label: subscription/masterTypeId != null

steps.comment: Diff full pull against the root, we want to see if you changed something beyond the fields you are master of
Limit to the subtype
Diff the partial against the root, don't take the primary key of the cdm into account
Map to the output
Map to the sync diffs
We have a full diff as well, let's compare our master diff
steps.label: subscription/masterTypeId != null

steps.comment: Retain all the diffs in the full diff that are not in the localized diff
Distinguish between array insertion/deletion and plain update diffs
If we have array insertion/deletion, we update the cdm immediately so future array changes are detected correctly. Other changes are combined into a bigger changeset
steps.label: arrayDiffToApplyImmediately

steps.comment: Patch all the changes together AND in order
steps.label: cdmDiff

steps.comment: If we have subscriptions, they were updated
steps.label: instanceSubscriptions

steps.comment: If we have any changes, let's set a new content as well
steps.label: output/changes

steps.comment: Deactivate any active instance contents
Create a new instance content
Map the output
Map the stopped for the sync
